p:
The above electrical and magnetic properties indicate that the Mn-doped Sr 4(Ru 1−xMn x) 3O 4 ( x = 0.34 and 0.41) is a ferromagnetic semiconductor with a narrow energy gap. This sets it apart from other sister compounds with Mn doping and adds a new member in a small magnetic semiconductor family. Further evidence for ferromagnetic semiconducting properties of Sr 4(Ru 1−xMn x) 3O 4 ( x = 0.34 and 0.41) is reflected in magnetoresistance (MR). Figure 4(a–d) show, for x = 0.34, the field dependence of the MR for I// ab and H// I (

. Third, MR measured in all configurations exhibits more or less linear field dependence without the sign of saturation up to 14 Tesla. The same features also are observed for x = 0.41 as shown in Fig. 4(e–h).
